DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluated the safety and immunogenicity of 3 formulations of Hib-MenCY-TT vaccine and 1 formulation of Hib-MenC-TT vaccine compared to a control group receiving licensed meningococcal serogroup C conjugate vaccine, each administered at 2, 3, and 4 months of age. Antibody persistence and immune responses to booster vaccinations were additionally assessed at 12 to 18 months of age.
DOC.brief_title: 3 Formulations of Hib-MenCY-TT Vaccine & 1 Formulation of Hib-MenC-TT Vaccine Compared to Licensed Meningococcal Serogroup C Conjugate Vaccine, Each Administered at 2,3,4 Mths of Age
DOC.detailed_description: Primary & booster vaccination study to evaluate the immuno,reacto & safety of 3 diff. formulations of GSKBio'combined Haemophilus influenzae typeb-meningococcal serogroups C & Y-conjugate vaccine & one formulation of GSKBio' Haemophilus influenzae typeb-meningococcal serogroup C conjugate vaccine each given concomitantly With Infanrix penta (DTaP-IPV-HepB vaccine), vs Meningitec meningococcal SerogroupC conj.vaccine) given concomitantly With Infanrix hexa (DTaP-IPV-HepB-Hib vaccine) in infants according a 2-3-4 mth schedule
DOC.criteria: Healthy infants without major congenital illness, immunosuppression, or chronic disease born at 36 to 42 weeks of gestation, between 6 and 12 weeks of age at enrollment, and vaccinated against hepatitis B at birth. Infants should not have received any investigational drug, vaccine, chronic immunosuppressants, or immunoglobulin or blood products.
DOC.keyword: Invasive bacterial disease caused by Hib
